question: What process can cause rocks and soil on a mountain to move downhill?

content.source_1: Erosion is the geologic process by which rock and soil are removed and transported from one location to another.
content.source_2: Gravity drives the downslope transport of loose rock and soil (mass movement), which is one of the mechanisms by which erosion moves material.
content.source_3: When rocks and soil slide down a mountain, they are moving downslope under the pull of gravity.
content.source_4: Weathering is the process that breaks rock into smaller pieces in place, without transporting the fragments.
content.source_5: Mechanical weathering (such as freezeâ€“thaw cracking and thermal expansion) weakens and loosens slope materials and commonly triggers rockfalls and landslides.
content.source_6: When moving sediment comes to rest and accumulates at the base of a slope, that settling is called deposition.
